personal_info.title: Ph.D.

professional_summary.description: Highly-skilled scientist seeking rewarding employment in computational chemistry, computational biology or Artificial Intelligence
professional_summary.unique_value: Broad experience in life science, computer systems, troubleshooting and customer service provides unique and valuable toolbox of skills
professional_summary.management_experience: Management experience in a Fortune 50 company with practical perspective on technology application

high_school.school: Lakota High School, West Chester, Ohio

graduate.school: Johns Hopkins Medical School, Baltimore MD
graduate.program: combined program for Biochemistry, Cellular and Molecular Biology
graduate.dissertation: Applications of Artificial Intelligence to Problems in Protein Engineering
graduate.notable: PhD advisors received the Nobel Prize for the discovery of EcoR1, establishing the Biotechnology field

specialized_skills: Virtual screening technologies to develop statistical models of drug efficacy

software_development: Developed one of the first real-time molecular visualization programs deployed on a personal computer (Commodore Amiga)
Developed the first computer-based rapid screening algorithm for disulfide bond stabilization in proteins of known structure
Invented structure-based heuristics with considerable state-space optimizations
Developed algorithms for rapid creation of photo-realistic lenticular and holographic images with emphasis on scientific visualization
scientific_modeling: Built high-resolution model of Parathyroid Hormone 1-34 from ab-initio modeling, subsequently verified with solution NMR
Built first model of 7 trans-membrane G-protein Coupled Receptors within P&G
Developed several high-potency small molecular candidates from the kinase family, used in osteoporosis therapy
Implemented bone turnover simulation based on John Reeves' work to establish initial dosing regimens for Actonel
infrastructure_management: Architected, deployed and managed a high-performance multi-processor supercomputer center for P&G Pharmaceuticals
Managed diverse, multi-national modeling and simulation community of practice within P&G R&D division
Led Research Computing and Informatics group at P&G Pharmaceuticals
database_development: Built the first database of all disulfide bonds in the RCSB protein databank (https://rcsb.org)
Dataset contains over 292,000 disulfide bonds, currently being analyzed with proteusPy Python package
